Package com.daml.ledger.rxjava.components

Class Bot

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.daml.ledger.rxjava.components.Bot
  • public class Bot
extends java.lang.Object
    A Bot is an automation that reacts to changes in the ledger by submitting zero or more commands. This class contains helpers to create bots. The main helper is wire(String, LedgerClient, TransactionFilter, Function, Function).

      Wires the Bot logic to an existing LedgerClient instance.
      static <R> io.reactivex.disposables.Disposable wire​(java.lang.String applicationId, LedgerClient ledgerClient, TransactionFilter transactionFilter, java.util.function.Function<LedgerViewFlowable.LedgerView<R>,​io.reactivex.Flowable<CommandsAndPendingSet>> bot, java.util.function.Function<CreatedContract,​R> transform, io.reactivex.Scheduler scheduler)
      Wires the Bot logic to an existing LedgerClient instance.

      Wires the Bot logic to an existing LedgerClient instance, storing CreatedContract instances in the LedgerViewFlowable.LedgerView.

    • Method Detail

      • wire

        public static <R> io.reactivex.disposables.Disposable wire​(java.lang.String applicationId,
                                                           LedgerClient ledgerClient,
                                                           TransactionFilter transactionFilter,
                                                           java.util.function.Function<LedgerViewFlowable.LedgerView<R>,​io.reactivex.Flowable<CommandsAndPendingSet>> bot,
                                                           java.util.function.Function<CreatedContract,​R> transform)
        Wires the Bot logic to an existing LedgerClient instance.
        Type Parameters:
        R - The type of the result of transform.
        Parameters:
        applicationId - The application identifier that will be sent to the Ledger
        ledgerClient - The LedgerClient instance which will be wired to the bot.
        transactionFilter - A server-side filter of incoming transactions
        bot - The business logic of the bot.
        transform - A function from the arguments of a Contract on the Ledger to a more refined type R. This can be used by the developer to, for instance, discard the fields of a Contract that are not needed and save space.
        Returns:
        The subscription representing the connection.

      • wire

        public static <R> io.reactivex.disposables.Disposable wire​(java.lang.String applicationId,
                                                           LedgerClient ledgerClient,
                                                           TransactionFilter transactionFilter,
                                                           java.util.function.Function<LedgerViewFlowable.LedgerView<R>,​io.reactivex.Flowable<CommandsAndPendingSet>> bot,
                                                           java.util.function.Function<CreatedContract,​R> transform,
                                                           io.reactivex.Scheduler scheduler)
        Wires the Bot logic to an existing LedgerClient instance.
        Type Parameters:
        R - The type of the result of transform.
        Parameters:
        applicationId - The application identifier that will be sent to the Ledger
        ledgerClient - The LedgerClient instance which will be wired to the bot.
        transactionFilter - A server-side filter of incoming transactions
        bot - The business logic of the bot.
        transform - A function from the arguments of a Contract on the Ledger to a more refined type R. This can be used by the developer to, for instance, discard the fields of a Contract that are not needed and save space.
        scheduler - The scheduler used to run the flows
        Returns:
        The subscription representing the connection.

        appId - The application identifier that will be sent to the Ledger
        ledgerClient - The LedgerClient instance which will be wired to the bot.
        transactionFilter - A server-side filter of incoming transactions
        bot - The business logic of the bot.
